topics.body:
"@trashboat":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5590a18f6368722734000385#post_5590a18f6368722734000385
It's just Gatchaman by name but it does it so much better.
It asks the moral question on whether the modern world needs superheroes when normal people, when working together, can do just the same. It's black and white and then Hajime comes in with her own perspective, which is in the grey area.

It's pretty exciting since it's hard to guess what'll happen next unlike the predictable story of the first.
topics.author: 4fe1b9f47f123b13df002976

topics.body:
"@HJSDGCE":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5590a2cb636872497d000091#post_5590a2cb636872497d000091
On the other hand. Who cares?

The original Gatchaman isn't shit just because the new one is "Deep". (It was made in the very early 70s for crying out loud, And it had some great bits.)
